title: Geometric typeface similar to Futura
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042631im_/http:/typophile.com/files/willandco_5002.png)

I know this typeface, I've used it, but I cannot remember the name of it and it's killing me!  
The Js, Fs and Es are quite narrow, and there's a distinctive G.  
Hopefully this is a simple ID for someone with better typeface ID expertise than me. Thanks in advance.
author: noogle

comments.content:
Neutra Face No. 2 Titling appears to be a match for the |WILL| and |CO|:  
 [http://www.houseind.com/fonts/neutraface2](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042631/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/neutraface2 "http://www.houseind.com/fonts/neutraface2")

But the ampersand appears to be from Calibre:  
 [https://klim.co.nz/retail-fonts/calibre/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042631/https:/klim.co.nz/retail-fonts/calibre/ "https://klim.co.nz/retail-fonts/calibre/")

The rest of the text is rather small and low-res, but perhaps Platform has a sufficiently narrow |J|:  
 [https://commercialtype.com/typefaces/platform](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042631/https:/commercialtype.com/typefaces/platform "https://commercialtype.com/typefaces/platform")

Hmm, yes, I thought of all of those — but I thought it was all one typeface. Now I see that the W in the smaller typeface is very different and the ampersand too.  
Definitely looks like Neutraface for the Will and Co. It's that smaller face I can't figure out. Thank you!
Looking at it all — I think you're right! Thanks!!
